newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-NAB cuts prime rate to 9.40 pct.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-NAB cuts prime rate to 9.40 pct.

text.p: National Australia Bank Ltd said on Friday it would cut its benchmark reference rate for major corporate customers to 9.40 percent, effective December 16.
The rate would be reduced from 9.90 percent.
NAB said its base reference rate, which applies to commercial and other borrowers, would also be reduced by 50 basis points to 9.75 percent from January 23 next year.
The Melbourne-based bank said the reductions followed the Reserve Bank's reduction in the official cash rate on Wednesday to 6.0 percent from 6.5 percent.
Australian banks have also reduced their mortgage rates in response to the monetary policy easing.
